channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Defying Protests, Mexico’s Senate Approves Judicial Overhaul
item.description: The chamber’s approval clears away the last major hindrance to the sweeping proposals championed by the president, which have prompted nationwide stri...

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli Forces Mount Fresh Raids in Two West Bank Cities
item.description: The Israeli military raided the occupied West Bank city of Tubas overnight, carrying out an airstrike that the Palestinian Authority’s Health Ministry...

item.title: USPS shakeup could mean higher shipping costs for consumers
item.description: The change comes as the busy holiday shipping season approaches.

item.title: Inflation Cooled in August, Keeping the Fed Poised to Cut Rates
item.description: Consumer Price Index inflation continued to cool, reaching a new three-year low. But signs of stubbornness lingered under the surface.

item.title: Defying Protests, Mexico’s Senate Approves Judicial Overhaul
item.description: The chamber’s approval clears away the last major hindrance to the sweeping proposals championed by the president, which have prompted nationwide stri...

item.title: California wildfires have already burned three times as many acres compared to all of 2023—and it’s about to get so much worse
item.description: Firefighters are using bulldozers, helicopters, and planes to control the rapidly spreading fires.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Discusses Meta at ‘Acquired’ Podcast Live Taping
item.description: Mr. Zuckerberg talked success to a packed house Tuesday night for the “Acquired” podcast. It’s a sign of how tech titans reach the public now.

item.title: The No. 1 Breaker in the World Is … Raygun?
item.description: The Australian breaker who was mocked at the Olympics for her kangaroo-hopping routine is now atop the official world rankings. Here’s how it happened...

item.title: Americans lost $5.6 billion to cryptocurrency fraud scams last year
item.description: FBI says that’s 45% more than in 2022.

item.title: Man Is Arrested for Arson as Wildfires Rage in the West, Including California and Nevada
item.description: No state is battling more large fires than Oregon. The authorities have arrested a man suspected of starting one of the biggest blazes in California.

item.title: Blinken Visits Kyiv During Precarious Moment in Ukraine War and U.S. Politics
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and his British counterpart, David Lammy, traveled to Kyiv aiming to show solidarity with Ukraine as the American...

item.title: A veteran CIA officer reached up a colleague’s skirt and forcibly kissed her in front of co-workers, prosecutors allege in sexual misconduct case
item.description: A 648-page internal watchdog report found systemic shortcomings in the CIA’s handling of such complaints.

item.title: Trump Made a Raving, Rambling Fool of Himself in That Debate
item.description: Donald Trump can be beaten. That was the clearest takeaway on Tuesday night.

item.title: North Korean Missiles Rain Down on Ukraine Despite Sanctions
item.description: Russia has received new shipments of Hwasong-11 short-range ballistic missiles, according to a new report.

item.title: After 155 years, Campbell’s is dropping ‘soup’ from its name
item.description: It won’t stop making its flagship product, though.
